basics.name: Zacharie Van Herstraeten
basics.label: Quantum information & optics researcher
basics.summary: Seeking photons in their most genuinely quantum regimes, tracking their Wigner functions across quantum phase space, and observing them through the lens of information theory.

work.name: Inria — École Normale Supérieure (ENS)
work.summary: Postdoctoral research in the QAT team with Dr. Ulysse Chabaud, employing phase-space methods to identify and characterize quantum resources.

work.name: College of Optical Sciences, University of Arizona
work.summary: Postdoctoral research in the Quantum Photonic Applications Group of Prof. Saikat Guha, focusing on quantum communication with continuous-variable systems.

volunteer.organization: QuiDiQua 3 — Quasiprobability Distributions in Quantum Mechanics, Optics and Information
volunteer.summary: Member of the organizing committee of the international conference QuiDiQua 3 (Paris, 2025), focusing on quasiprobability distributions and phase-space methods.
Developer and maintainer of an open-source Python toolkit for Wigner functions, bosonic channels, and visualization in quantum optics.

volunteer.organization: École polytechnique de Bruxelles, Université libre de Bruxelles (ULB)
volunteer.summary: Taught exercise sessions and lectures in the quantum mechanics course for third-year engineering students. Supervised the master's theses of two students.
Reviewer for various journals in quantum information and quantum physics.

education.institution: École polytechnique de Bruxelles, Université libre de Bruxelles (ULB)
education.area: Doctoral research conducted at the Center for Quantum Information and Communication (QuIC), under the supervision of Prof. Nicolas J. Cerf. PhD thesis: Majorization theoretical approach to quantum uncertainty — From Wigner entropy to Gaussian bosonic channels.
